text:
Hi There,

I'm new to the Java World. I have some experience using PowerTier for EJB. 
There used to be a problem with the Servlet Mill in PowerTier and I see the 
same type of problem with Tomcat 3.2.3.

I know that the reloadable in JSP is exploratory. I have 2 JSP Pages. The first 
one includes the second. If I make changes to the second page and refresh my 
explorer, the changes doesn't seem to take place. So every time I make a change 
to the second page, I will have to go back to the first page and make a small 
change somewhere and save it again. Then it works.

Hope this helps.

Thanx,
Dinesh, S.
creator: dinesh@golisa.com

A fix is available ( in the experimental jasper repository ),  will be included
in a future version of jasper. For 3.3 - it's a bit dangerous.
creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com

text:
At this point, tracking include dependencies within JSPs is a feature that
won't be implemented in Tomcat 3.3.x's Jasper.

The experimental jasper repository is jakarta-tomcat-jasper, in case you can
find something useful there.
creator: Larry.Isaacs@sas.com
